text: Discussion：Feasibility of Pluto as a tool to develop julia packages:slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: Discussion：Feasibility of Pluto as a tool to develop julia packages

text:
I used to develop packages in Python using Jupyter notebooks. Now I think it's a terrible idea - but of course it comes down to what workflow works for you.
Generally though, good editors will be more helpful than notebooks: They have linters and spell checkers, better auto-suggestions and file explorers, and more settings

elements.text:
I used to develop packages in Python using Jupyter notebooks. Now I think it's a terrible idea - but of course it comes down to what workflow works for you.
Generally though, good editors will be more helpful than notebooks: They have linters and spell checkers, better auto-suggestions and file explorers, and more settings

text: Pluto would be better than Jupyter since the notebooks are just Julia code and comments.

elements.text: Pluto would be better than Jupyter since the notebooks are just Julia code and comments.

text: For initial developement and trying things out pluto is nice, but for creating the package it might be a bit annoying

elements.text: For initial developement and trying things out pluto is nice, but for creating the package it might be a bit annoying

text: one thing that I love about Pluto is that structs are 'revisable' , whereas normal Revise doesn't like it when I edit structs

elements.text: one thing that I love about Pluto is that structs are 'revisable' , whereas normal Revise doesn't like it when I edit structs

text: so for trying to figure out how I should define my structs it's nice to iterate in that environment before moving to VS Code for the real implementation

elements.text: so for trying to figure out how I should define my structs it's nice to iterate in that environment before moving to VS Code for the real implementation
